issue.title: govaluate types mismatch

labels.name: support
labels.description: User support issue - likely not a bug

issue.body:
## Summary 
I am trying to run a workflow with some conditional steps(I am trying to figure out if a new branch in GitLab was created):
`when: "{{inputs.parameters.sha-before}} != 0000000000000000000000000000000000000000 && {{inputs.parameters.sha-after}} == 0000000000000000000000000000000000000000"`

But this comparison would fail with an error:
`Error node gitlab-workflow-render-gb79x[0]: Invalid 'when' expression '5d1ca167fd6272d60bbf69f49f0a0ca502765081 == '0000000000000000000000000000000000000000' && 5d1ca167fd6272d60bbf69f49f0a0ca502765081 != '0000000000000000000000000000000000000000'': Cannot transition token types from NUMERIC [5] to VARIABLE [d1ca167fd6272d60bbf69f49f0a0ca502765081]`

It looks like govaluate thinks that commit hash is of some numeric type...

## Diagnostics

What Kubernetes provider are you using? 
Yandex Cloud

What version of Argo Workflows are you running? 
3.0.1

```yaml
Paste a workflow that reproduces the bug, including status:
kubectl get wf -o yaml ${workflow} 

apiVersion: argoproj.io/v1alpha1
kind: Workflow
metadata:
  annotations:
    argo: workflows
  labels:
    env: devdynamic
    events.argoproj.io/action-timestamp: "1617984446200"
    events.argoproj.io/sensor: gitlab-project-render
    events.argoproj.io/trigger: gitlab-workflow-render-trigger
    workflows.argoproj.io/completed: "true"
    workflows.argoproj.io/controller-instanceid: system-controller
    workflows.argoproj.io/phase: Failed
  name: gitlab-workflow-render-fw6mg
  namespace: argo-events
spec:
  arguments:
    parameters:
    - name: ref
      value: master
    - name: sha-before
      value: 5d1ca167fd6272d60bbf69f49f0a0ca502765081
    - name: sha-after
      value: 5d1ca167fd6272d60bbf69f49f0a0ca502765081
  entrypoint: infra-handler
  templates:
  - inputs:
      parameters:
      - name: sha-before
      - name: sha-after
    metadata: {}
    name: infra-handler
    outputs: {}
    serviceAccountName: argo-events-sa
    steps:
    - - arguments:
          parameters:
          - name: ref
            value: '{{workflow.parameters.ref}}'
        name: create-on-branch-commence
        template: infra-generator
        when: '{{inputs.parameters.sha-before}} == 0000000000000000000000000000000000000000
          && {{inputs.parameters.sha-after}} != 0000000000000000000000000000000000000000'
      - arguments:
          parameters:
          - name: ref
            value: '{{workflow.parameters.ref}}'
        name: destroy-on-branch-abstand
        template: infra-destroyer
        when: '{{inputs.parameters.sha-before}} != 0000000000000000000000000000000000000000
          && {{inputs.parameters.sha-after}} == 0000000000000000000000000000000000000000'
  - container:
      args:
      - echo
      - branch created= {{inputs.parameters.ref}}
      image: argoproj/argosay:v2
      name: ""
      resources: {}
    inputs:
      parameters:
      - name: ref
    metadata: {}
    name: infra-generator
    outputs: {}
    serviceAccountName: argo-events-sa
  - container:
      args:
      - echo
      - branch deleted= {{inputs.parameters.ref}}
      image: argoproj/argosay:v2
      name: ""
      resources: {}
    inputs:
      parameters:
      - name: ref
    metadata: {}
    name: infra-destroyer
    outputs: {}
    serviceAccountName: argo-events-sa
  ttlStrategy:
    secondsAfterSuccess: 5
status:
  artifactRepositoryRef:
    default: true
  conditions:
  - status: "True"
    type: Completed
  finishedAt: "2021-04-09T16:11:08Z"
  message: 'Invalid ''when'' expression ''5d1ca167fd6272d60bbf69f49f0a0ca502765081
    == 0000000000000000000000000000000000000000 && 5d1ca167fd6272d60bbf69f49f0a0ca502765081
    != 0000000000000000000000000000000000000000'': Cannot transition token types from
    NUMERIC [5] to VARIABLE [d1ca167fd6272d60bbf69f49f0a0ca502765081]'
  nodes:
    gitlab-workflow-render-ffq9c:
      children:
      - gitlab-workflow-render-ffq9c-4264465097
      displayName: gitlab-workflow-render-ffq9c
      finishedAt: "2021-04-09T16:11:08Z"
      id: gitlab-workflow-render-ffq9c
      inputs:
        parameters:
        - name: sha-before
          value: 5d1ca167fd6272d60bbf69f49f0a0ca502765081
        - name: sha-after
          value: 5d1ca167fd6272d60bbf69f49f0a0ca502765081
      message: 'Invalid ''when'' expression ''5d1ca167fd6272d60bbf69f49f0a0ca502765081
        == 0000000000000000000000000000000000000000 && 5d1ca167fd6272d60bbf69f49f0a0ca502765081
        != 0000000000000000000000000000000000000000'': Cannot transition token types
        from NUMERIC [5] to VARIABLE [d1ca167fd6272d60bbf69f49f0a0ca502765081]'
      name: gitlab-workflow-render-ffq9c
      phase: Failed
      startedAt: "2021-04-09T16:11:08Z"
      templateName: infra-handler
      templateScope: local/gitlab-workflow-render-ffq9c
      type: Steps
    gitlab-workflow-render-ffq9c-4264465097:
      boundaryID: gitlab-workflow-render-ffq9c
      displayName: '[0]'
      finishedAt: "2021-04-09T16:11:08Z"
      id: gitlab-workflow-render-ffq9c-4264465097
      message: 'Invalid ''when'' expression ''5d1ca167fd6272d60bbf69f49f0a0ca502765081
        == 0000000000000000000000000000000000000000 && 5d1ca167fd6272d60bbf69f49f0a0ca502765081
        != 0000000000000000000000000000000000000000'': Cannot transition token types
        from NUMERIC [5] to VARIABLE [d1ca167fd6272d60bbf69f49f0a0ca502765081]'
      name: gitlab-workflow-render-ffq9c[0]
      phase: Error
      startedAt: "2021-04-09T16:11:08Z"
      templateScope: local/gitlab-workflow-render-ffq9c
      type: StepGroup
  phase: Failed
  progress: 0/0
  startedAt: "2021-04-09T16:11:08Z"

```

```

kubectl logs -n argo $(kubectl get pods -l app=workflow-controller -n argo -o name) | grep ${workflow}
```

comment.body: What @alexec suggested worked for me. I.e. `"'{{workflow.parameters.<your-param>}}' != '<your-string>'"`. Although in our setup (GKE + ArgoCD) the double quotes got converted to 2 single quotes and the single quotes as well.

pull_request.title: Update documentation: change sso secret keys
pull_request.body:
<!-- markdownlint-disable MD041 -->

<!--

### Before you open your PR

- Run `make pre-commit -B` to fix codegen and lint problems (build will fail).
- [Signed-off your commits](https://github.com/apps/dco/) (otherwise the DCO check will fail).
- Used [a conventional commit message](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/).

### When you open your PR

- PR title format should also conform to [conventional commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/).
- "Fixes #" is in both the PR title (for release notes) and this description (to automatically link and close the issue).
- Create the PR as draft.
- Once builds are green, mark your PR "Ready for review".

When changes are requested, please address them and then dismiss the review to get it reviewed again.

-->

<!-- Does this PR fix an issue -->

Fixes SSO documentaion for secret creation

### Motivation
The example code had to be updated to the wright keys for the secret.
https://argoproj.github.io/argo-workflows/argo-server-sso/#to-start-argo-server-with-sso

<!-- TODO: Say why you made your changes. -->

### Modifications
Change the `client-id` and `client-secret ` key in the example code snippet, so that it's matching for https://github.com/argoproj/argo-helm/blob/804af65b38dd1c4a27a3df5fb478d18c126a6e24/charts/argo-workflows/values.yaml#L655C21-L655C21
<!-- TODO: Say what changes you made. -->

### Verification
-

issue.title: Proposal: Separation of Execution Authority for Workflows using WorkflowTemplate
issue.body:
# Summary

I think it is better to have separate permissions for executing Workflows that use WorkflowTemplate and for executing new Workflows.
There must be people (not developers) who regularly execute Workflows that use WorkflowTemplate,
In many cases, it is not necessary to be able to execute other Workflows.

## Use Cases

- Use when you do not want arbitrary code to be executed.

---
<!-- Issue Author: Don't delete this message to encourage other users to support your issue! -->
**Message from the maintainers**:

Love this enhancement proposal? Give it a 👍. We prioritise the proposals with the most 👍.

comment.body: Sorry for asking, but I would like to clarify, `notifySemaphoreConfigUpdate` should be called for all CM caught by this informer or there is some exception (in the [current code](https://github.com/argoproj/argo-workflows/blob/master/workflow/controller/controller.go#L422) I think so)?

pull_request.title: fix: Refactor the func runConfigMapWatcher to use Informers. Fixes #11657
pull_request.body:
Fixes #11657 
Fixes #11463 

Conflit #11799 

### Motivation

After some time running, when the connection to k8s API is broken (timeout for example), the watcher cannot handle the exception increases the CPU usage, and floods the log with the message `level=error msg="invalid config map object received in config watcher. Ignored processing"`. After reaching the pod limit, it'll be restarted. See #11657  for details.


### Modifications

I replaced the function with a new one using informers (many thanks @agilgur5 ).
I tried to use the code pattern used by other functions, but please let me know if something can be improved.
I also changed the namespace used to "managed-namespace" instead of "namespace" (This change will solve #11463 )

### Verification
Manual changes in the ConfigMap are being watched and applied;
An instance with this change is running for a while;
We also did some integration and performance tests;

![shell](https://github.com/argoproj/argo-workflows/assets/6254271/7c1fbabf-48d0-4148-b5b6-5b088af4eb73)

<!-- TODO: Say how you tested your changes. -->

pull_request.title: fix: Refactor the func runConfigMapWatcher to use Informers. Fixes #11657
pull_request.body:
Fixes #11657 
Fixes #11463 

Conflit #11799 

### Motivation

After some time running, when the connection to k8s API is broken (timeout for example), the watcher cannot handle the exception increases the CPU usage, and floods the log with the message `level=error msg="invalid config map object received in config watcher. Ignored processing"`. After reaching the pod limit, it'll be restarted. See #11657  for details.


### Modifications

I replaced the function with a new one using informers (many thanks @agilgur5 ).
I tried to use the code pattern used by other functions, but please let me know if something can be improved.
I also changed the namespace used to "managed-namespace" instead of "namespace" (This change will solve #11463 )

### Verification
Manual changes in the ConfigMap are being watched and applied;
An instance with this change is running for a while;
We also did some integration and performance tests;

![shell](https://github.com/argoproj/argo-workflows/assets/6254271/7c1fbabf-48d0-4148-b5b6-5b088af4eb73)

<!-- TODO: Say how you tested your changes. -->

issue.title: Proposal: add the ability of distributed Tracing

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: go
labels.description: Pull requests that update Go code

issue.body:
# Summary

Currently, we could leverage Prometheus to see some important metrics of Argo Workflow. But it would be wonderful if we could see the tracing, so it's helpful for checking potential neckbottle.

## Use Cases

[Apache Skywalking](https://skywalking.apache.org/) is a very popular tool which have both front-end and backend for the tracing feature. And the news is that we don't need modify any current code lines to archive that. [Apache Skywalking Go Agent](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-go) will do it during the compile process.

I'd be happy to do it if I could got positive feddback.

---
<!-- Issue Author: Don't delete this message to encourage other users to support your issue! -->
**Message from the maintainers**:

Love this enhancement proposal? Give it a 👍. We prioritise the proposals with the most 👍.

issue.title: expression `{{= workflow?.outputs?.parameters?.my_param ?? 'na' }}` always return `na`
issue.body:
### Pre-requisites

- [X] I have double-checked my configuration
- [X] I can confirm the issues exists when I tested with `:latest`
- [ ] I'd like to contribute the fix myself (see [contributing guide](https://github.com/argoproj/argo-workflows/blob/master/docs/CONTRIBUTING.md))

### What happened/what you expected to happen?

Running workflow with global output parameter, that is used in metrics label value with expression containing "??" always evaluates as if the parameter value is `nil`. The reason for using the condition is to support step failing, when the outputs are not generated and in that case I want to fallback to `"na"`.

Running the workflow below, after completed, the value of `.spec.metrics` is

```
{
  "prometheus": [
    {
      "name": "test_metric",
      "labels": [
        {
          "key": "param",
          "value": "na"
        }
      ],
      "help": "Test metric",
      "counter": {
        "value": "1"
      }
    }
  ]
}
```

Expected value is:
```
{
  "prometheus": [
    {
      "name": "test_metric",
      "labels": [
        {
          "key": "param",
          "value": "hello world"
        }
      ],
      "help": "Test metric",
      "counter": {
        "value": "1"
      }
    }
  ]
}
```

To check, the value of `.status.outputs` is correct as expected:

```
{
  "parameters": [
    {
      "name": "my_global_param",
      "value": "hello world"
    }
  ]
}
```

When setting the expression to `"{{= workflow?.outputs?.parameters?.my_global_param }}"` (i.e. removing the safe conditional), the evaluated value in the metric label is correct.

### Version

v3.4.9

### Paste a small workflow that reproduces the issue. We must be able to run the workflow; don't enter a workflows that uses private images.

```YAML
apiVersion: argoproj.io/v1alpha1
kind: Workflow
metadata:
  generateName: global-outputs-
spec:
  entrypoint: generate-globals
  serviceAccountName: argo

  templates:
  - name: generate-globals
    steps:
    - - name: generate
        template: global-output
  - name: global-output
    container:
      image: alpine:3.7
      command: [sh, -c]
      args: ["sleep 1; echo -n hello world > /tmp/hello_world.txt"]
    outputs:
      parameters:
      - name: hello-param
        valueFrom:
          path: /tmp/hello_world.txt
        globalName: my_global_param

  metrics:
    prometheus:
      - name: test_metric
        help: Test metric
        counter:
          value: "1"
        labels:
        - key: param
          value: "{{= workflow?.outputs?.parameters?.my_global_param ?? 'na' }}"
```


### Logs from the workflow controller


comment.body:
> Hmm, I wonder if the parser is getting confused by the safe conditional -- since it can't directly look up `pod?.name` like it can with `pod.name`. Though IIRC, the entire variable, such as `pod`, is just passed to `expr`.
> 
> Does re-writing it without the safe conditional short-hand, e.g. as `(pod && pod.name) || 'na'`, work fine?

Thanks for your suggestion, but it seems all node fails with this message.
> error: cannot finish template replacement because the result was invalid JSON

There are more messages stated from `summary > conditions` in the web UI.
> MetricsError: unable to substitute parameters for metric 'exec_duration_gauge': failed to evaluate expression: invalid operation: || (mismatched types bool and string) (1:19) | (pod && pod.name) || 'na' | ..................^


Tried `{{=pod == nil ? 'na' : pod.name}}`  as well, but it's always evaluted as 'na'

pull_request.title: fix: ArtifactGC Fails for Stopped Workflows. Fixes #11879
pull_request.body:
<!-- markdownlint-disable MD041 -->

<!-- Does this PR fix an issue -->

Fixes #11879

### Motivation

<!-- TODO: Say why you made your changes. -->

Currently, stopped workflows will happily save artifacts to a storage bucket but the artifacts won't get garbage collected after workflow deletion. The changes make it so that a stopped workflow's artifacts are properly garbage collected upon workflow deletion.

### Modifications

<!-- TODO: Say what changes you made. -->

The `operator.go`'s call to `woc.taskResultReconciliation()` previously occurred after Artifact Garbage Collection (`ArtifactGC`) and an early return due to `if woc.wf.Labels[common.LabelKeyCompleted] == "true"`, leading to a scenerio in which garbage collection would fail upon workflow deletion. This in turn would cause workflow deletion to get blocked by the ArtifactGC finalizer. `woc.taskResultReconciliation()` is responsible for updating the node status in the workflow based on the artifact outputs saved during workflow execution with `reportOutputs()` in `executor.go`. 

<!-- TODO: Attach screenshots if you changed the UI. -->

### Verification

<!-- TODO: Say how you tested your changes. -->

I tested the changes by adding an `e2e` test called `TestStoppedWorkflow` which uses a custom workflow with the following logic.

1) Ensure no artifact exists in the bucket.
2) Start the workflow.
3) Workflow runs and creates a test artifact.
4) Verifiy the artifact exists in the bucket.
4) The workflow submits a CLI-based stop event for itself.
5) The workflow is deleted by the test.
6) Artifacts are verified to have been deleted.
7) Finalizer is removed incase the test failed.

---

I made some additional minor tweaks to other files, most notably, `timeout = v - 30*time.Second + defaultTimeout` in `when.go` which would cause custom timeout settings to be incorrect when using the `WaitForWorkflow()` e2e testing utility.

comment.body: or let me know if you had something else in mind and I can try to advise based on that...I would for one like to remove the fact that two different reportOutputs-type methods are called at the end of the wait function

comment.body: So, what I was thinking was this: remove all of the existing changes in wait.go and all of the report methods here. In the createTaskResult() function set this label to false. Then in wait.go do a `defer wfExecutor.FinalizeOutput()`. That method just upserts the label set to true. See any reason that can't work or isn't good design? It seems simple anyway.
